content.description: Really cool movement through the giant slopey rail that cuts across the boulder. Starts with left hand on a pinch(crimp and pocket combo) and right hand on a 3/4 pad crimp on the very left side of the rail. Traverse right through the slopey rail to finish on the same exit as The Saloon. Bit of a sketchy landing so a spotter is recommended. As I imagine this hold may cause a bit of confusion, the juggy pocket in the middle of the route is on.
content.protection: At least 3 pads and a spotter.
content.location: To the left of The Saloon.

content.description: The proudest, most obvious line on the boulder. Starts matched low on slopey sidepull in the seam(about 3 feet off the ground). Goes directly up from there using the jugs/pockets in the seam and the edges on the face. From the sloper-jug on the rail continue directly up for a dicey top out. Really fun movement. Low start matched on the big pinch goes at V8.

Starts on the arete using a left hand sidepull directly below the start of "The Saloon" and a right hand 3-finger spike. Powerful first move leads up into compression on edges and finishes up the same exit as "The Saloon". Really fun movement.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter
content.location: To the right of The Saloon
